elements.title: 1942 Eleftherias Square roundup
elements.contents: ... that 9,000 Greek Jews were targeted by the 1942 Eleftherias Square roundup (pictured), and those who collapsed were attacked by dogs?

elements.title: Ellora Derenoncourt
elements.contents: ... that Ellora Derenoncourt demonstrated that the expansion of minimum wage in 1967 accounted for 20 percent of the reduction in racial income gaps in the United States during the civil rights era?

elements.title: Takarazuka Grand Theater
elements.contents: ... that Japanese industrialist Ichizō Kobayashi established the Takarazuka Grand Theater in the city of Takarazuka because it was located at the terminus of a train line owned by his company?

elements.title: Marja Kubašec
elements.contents: ... that Marja Kubašec was both the first Sorbian woman to receive a formal teacher training and the first woman to write a novel in Upper Sorbian?

elements.title: Roxham Road
elements.contents: ... that the many refugees who have entered Canada via Roxham Road at the border between New York and Quebec since 2017 may not have been breaking any laws?

elements.title: Cerro Overo
elements.contents: ... that the volcanic crater Cerro Overo formed about 77,000 years ago?

elements.title: June Fernández
elements.contents: ... that June Fernández wrote "I Wanted Sex But Not Like That"?

elements.title: 1960 European Nations' Cup Final
elements.contents: ... that the meagre attendance at the 1960 European Nations' Cup Final in Paris was blamed on crowds who "wanted western European glamour, not mysterious teams from the other side of Europe"?
